snippet: Hiroyuki Nakajima, a shortstop, will return to his Japanese team after failing to reach an agreement with the Yankees.
abstract: Hiroyuki Nakajima, a shortstop, will return to his Japanese team after failing to reach an agreement with the Yankees.

byline.original: By TYLER KEPNER AND DAVID WALDSTEIN

lead_paragraph: 9:16 p.m. | Updated Hiroyuki Nakajima was never a snug fit with the Yankees, who won his negotiating rights last month with a $2 million bid. Nakajima is a career .310 hitter in Japan and had 16 homers and 100 runs batted in last season. He isalso a shortstop, which means that, as a Yankee, Nakajima would not have gotten much playing time behind Derek Jeter.

headline.main: Yankees, Nakajima Unable to Make a Deal
